subject: Re: Investigation Request – Client Reports of Link Issues
preview: Hi Sherry,  No worries at all, always happy to help!  If anything else comes up, just let me know and I’ll look into it right away.

full_threads.body:
Hi Sherry,

No worries at all, always happy to help!

If anything else comes up, just let me know and I’ll look into it right away.

Got this.

Thank you so much for the clarification.

Sherry

.
.
Hammer Hire Marketing
.

P 1800426637E marketing@hammerhire.com.au
W www.hammerhire.com.au
32 Williamson Road, Ingleburn , NSW 2565


.
CYBER SECURITY WARNING:

We will never email you advising a change in our bank account details. If you do receive an email advising a change in bank account details or requesting you to bank funds into an account you should telephone us. We will always telephone you to confirm any change in bank details and to confirm any bank details that you provide to us by email. Please telephone to confirm our banking details prior to making any payments.

Hi Sherry,

That’s correct, the error your client saw wasn’t coming from your website.

Everything on your site, including the SSL certificate, is working as it should.

It’s most likely due to something on the client’s side, such as:
  • A security filter or firewall blocking the link
  • A cached redirect from their browser
  • An issue with the Mailchimp tracking link

Going ahead with the Mailchimp email authentication should help prevent this kind of issue in the future, but rest assured, your site is all good on our end.

Hi Allie,

Just to clarify, does this mean that the error from the client was not from our website itself?

Thank you,
Sherry

.
.
Hammer Hire Marketing
.

P 1800426637E marketing@hammerhire.com.au
W www.hammerhire.com.au
32 Williamson Road, Ingleburn , NSW 2565


.
CYBER SECURITY WARNING:

We will never email you advising a change in our bank account details. If you do receive an email advising a change in bank account details or requesting you to bank funds into an account you should telephone us. We will always telephone you to confirm any change in bank details and to confirm any bank details that you provide to us by email. Please telephone to confirm our banking details prior to making any payments.

Hi Sherry,

Thanks for sending this through.

We’ve checked in with our team and just wanted to share a quick update:
  • Everything’s working fine on our end
  • We recommend starting the Mailchimp authentication process to help avoid future link issues
  • Since we don’t host your DNS, the best person to assist with the next step will be Alice at Concise IT (alice@conciseit.com.au)
  • If you can share the DNS records from Mailchimp with her, she’ll be able to update them directly

Let me know if there’s anything else I can do, always happy to help!

Hi Allie,

This client told us that whenever they clicked an email from our marketing email (via mailchimp), they redirected to a "404 Page | Dynamic Accounting". I will send to you one of our email marketing after this email.
It's kind of weird since the links from the marketing email were all good on our end, except for this specific client which contacted us that they can't access our website.

May we ask if this is something on our end?
Also need your help in email authentication process from mailchimp.


.
.
Hammer Hire Marketing
.

P 1800426637E marketing@hammerhire.com.au
W www.hammerhire.com.au
32 Williamson Road, Ingleburn , NSW 2565


.

Hi Sherry,

Thanks so much for letting us know, and for checking the links on your side.

To help us get this fixed quickly, could you please:
  • Forward us the exact email your clients are clicking from and we'll test it from our end.

A quick note:
  • The SSL certificate on your website is active and working fine on our end.
  • Once we have the example email, we’ll investigate right away and track down the cause.

Let me know if there's anything else I can do, always happy to help

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body: I think this is a problem with their marketing email - checking this now

Hi Team,
We've received reports from some clients that when they click on our web link from an email, they encounter a security certificate warning or are redirected to a 404 error page (some have mentioned "accounting dynamic" in the message).
We've already reviewed and tested all links on our end, and they appear to be working correctly without any visible errors.
Could you please investigate further and help identify what might be causing these issues so we can address them promptly?
Thank you,
Sherry
